intro: Scaligeria ferganensis, commonly known as the Fergana scaleria, is a rare flowering plant native to Central Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels. It typically grows in rocky or sandy soils in arid or semi-arid environments. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
